page.title: 08DAILY LIFE IN CROOKEDHOLM.
page.content: Most of the people in Crookedholm if they have work, as there is high unemployment in the area, travel to Kilmarnock or Hurlford. The majority are manual workers. All of the school children in the village attend either the small local primary or James Hamilton Academy, both within walking distance. Most of the housing is local authority. Leisure time can be spent in the countryside around the village or at the various events in the Community Centre (eg. bingo, discos, youth clubs). In nearby Kilmarnock there are many pubs, hotels, wine bars, bingo halls, a cinema, a theatre, a country park and many smaller parks. Kilmarnock also has an excellent shopping centre. There are good libraries in Kilmarnock and Hurlford.
